result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron M. Guerra was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Aaron M. Guerra is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Aaron M. Guerra was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to pay costs and DNA surcharge within 60 days (12/4/15) or request a payment plan through the Dodge County Clerk of Courts office within said time.

in Dodge County Jail with Huber and Transfer with 30 days presentence credit - TIME SERVED.  Defendant may still be on PO hold.
Consecutive to: any other sentence

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Aaron M. Guerra in court, in custody with attorney Greg E. Vollan.  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def. in custody unable to post bond; Atty. Vollan heard on recomm.; Court reviews charge/penalties in Count 2; victim rights complied with; Def. pleads NC to DC in Count 2; Court reviews GPQPA & WOR; parties stip. to facts; Court finds plea made FVK&I and finds Def. guilty of Count 2 DC w/Count 1 Dismissed; State heard; Atty. Vollan heard; Def. declines to make statement; Court imposes sentence; Def. remanded

* 30 days in DCJ w/H&Tr. w/30 days credit - TIME SERVED (but still on PO hold)
* $243 CC within 60 days
* $200 DNA surcharge
Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.

Return date at 10-05-2015 02:30 pm.
Jury trial at 11-04-2015 08:30 am.

1:01 - Defendant Aaron M. Guerra in court, in custody with attorney Jaclyn R. Shelton (may be eligible).  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Court finds probable cause. Court enters Not Guilty plea. RD & JT set. Court sets $500 Cash bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.  Return date scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
